Package cs12b.mySQL_PA

Class GenericConsoleTester

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs12b.mySQL_PA.GenericConsoleTester
  • public class GenericConsoleTester
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides the ability to test some generic program that uses console input and output. It has replaced the old testing system which comprised of utility files full of static methods that had to be tweaked for each assignment.
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Eitan Joseph, Chami Lamelas

        The old output stream

      • newPrintOut

        private java.io.PrintStream newPrintOut
        The new output stream (used by various methods). The new input stream is used once and is not stored as a field.

      • byteOut

        private java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream byteOut
        The new output stream (used only in default output generation testing).

    • Constructor Detail

      • GenericConsoleTester

        public GenericConsoleTester()
        Constructs a default tester. That is, one that does not generate output files in the testing process.

      • GenericConsoleTester

        public GenericConsoleTester​(boolean keepOutFiles)
        Constructs a tester that generates output files for testing. One can specify whether or not to keep them.
        Parameters:
        keepOutFiles - boolean representing whether or not to keep output files

    • Method Detail

      • storeOldStreams

        public void storeOldStreams()
        Backs up the default system input/output streams.

      • cleanUpStreamsAndFiles

        public void cleanUpStreamsAndFiles()
        Resets the default system input/output streams and deletes any opened files.

      • setUpInputStream

        public void setUpInputStream​(java.lang.String... linesToTest)
        Sets up the input stream given an arbitrary number of Strings (or String array). It is assumed that the elements in the input parameter are to be separate lines of input in the test program.
        Parameters:
        linesToTest - lines of input to test

      • setUpOutStream

        public void setUpOutStream()
        Sets up the output stream for default testing; that is, with no output file generation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if file-generation testing was chosen in object construction

      • setUpOutStream

        public void setUpOutStream​(java.lang.String filePath)
        Sets up the output stream to a specified file. This is to be used in the file-generation version of testing.
        Parameters:
        filePath - the file path to the generated output file
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if default testing was chosen in object construction

      • getActual

        public java.lang.String getActual()
        Gets the actual output for the test. That is, it gets the student's generated output (regardless of the output method) after their code has been run.
        Returns:
        the actual output for the test or null if an error occurred in processing the output
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if output stream was not created /
